item.title: Apple Readies Feature That Lets Vision Pro Users Scroll With Their Eyes
item.description: Apple Inc. is developing a feature for its Vision Pro headset that lets users scroll through software with their eyes, aiming to enhance the device with a novel interface.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: An upcoming feature for the Apple Vision Pro headset will let users scroll with their eyes.

item.title: S&P 500 Grinds Higher As Chipmakers’ Shares Rise on Gulf Deals
item.description: US stocks edged higher on Wednesday, as chipmakers’ shares advanced following a series of high-profile deals announced during President Donald Trump’s tour of the Persian Gulf while gains in the broader market slowed after a blistering rally.
item.dc:creator: Jess Menton

media:content.media:description: Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange.

item.title: Misinformation Alleging Cocaine Use Gives European Leaders a Jolt
item.dc:creator: Daniel Zuidijk

media:content.media:description: Keir Starmer, Emmanuel Macron and Friedrich Merz on a train to Kyiv on May 9.

item.title: Uber Targets Commuters With Cheaper Pooled Rides, Price-Lock Pass
item.description: Uber Technologies Inc. is introducing a cheaper pooled rides option and a price-lock pass for commuters, underscoring its focus on attracting more daily users as consumers confront rising costs.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Lung

media:content.media:description: Sachin Kansal, chief product officer of Uber Technologies Inc., speaks during an Uber product unveiling event in New York, US, on Wednesday, May 14, 2025. Uber Technologies Inc. introduced a cheaper pooled rides option and a price-lock pass for commuters, underscoring its focus on attracting more daily users as consumers confront rising costs.

item.title: Telefonica Is Said to Draw Up Plans for Liberty’s VMO2 Stake
item.description: Telefonica SA is drawing up plans for a deal that would allow it to take control of the UK joint venture it owns with Liberty Global Ltd., according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Vinicy Chan, Clara Hernanz Lizarraga, Jillian Deutsch

media:content.media:description: Marc Murtra Photographer: Angel Garcia/Bloomberg

item.title: Nubank Gains Post-Earnings, Bucking Profitability Concerns
item.description: Shares of Nu Holdings Ltd. gained on Wednesday, bucking a slump in overnight trading, after the digital bank’s first quarter earnings showed strong revenue growth weighed down by higher spending to attract new clients and protect against potential bad loans.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Cancel

media:content.media:description: Nubank headquarters in Sao Paulo, Brazil, on Wednesday, May 15, 2024. Nu Holdings Ltd., one of the world's largest digital banks, surpassed 100 million clients across its operations in Brazil, Mexico and Colombia.

item.title: Trump’s Mideast Visit Opens Floodgate of AI Deals Led by Nvidia
item.description: The Trump administration is clearing a path for two key Persian Gulf allies to pursue their artificial intelligence ambitions — and some of the biggest US tech companies are seizing on that opening with plans to spend billions of dollars in the region.
item.dc:creator: Michael Shepard, Mackenzie Hawkins, Ian King

media:content.media:description: President Donald Trump speaks during the Saudi-US business investment forum in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, on May 13, 2025.

item.title: AI Boom Has Generac Looking to Data Centers for Growth
item.description: Generac Holdings Inc. made its name providing backup generators to homes whipsawed by hurricanes and ice storms. Now, it’s chasing a new market: data centers.
item.dc:creator: Mark Chediak, Lauren Rosenthal

media:content.media:description: Aaron Jagdfeld during an interview in New York on May 13 Photographer: Michael Nagle/Bloomberg

item.title: Alibaba Sustains AI Frenzy With Second Video Upgrade in Weeks
item.description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. updated its video-generating model for the second time in one month as Chinese firms look to better compete against each other and American rivals in the white-hot AI race.
item.dc:creator: Claire Che

media:content.media:description: Signage at the Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. headquarters in Hangzhou, China, on Thursday, Feb. 6, 2025. President Donald Trump's new trade levies against China includes a broadside against international e-commerce, with apparent plans to extinguish a long-held tariff exemption for packages worth less than $800. Photographer: Qilai Shen/Bloomberg

item.title: Tencent Grows Fastest Since 2021 in Good Start to Rocky Year
item.description: Tencent Holdings Ltd.’s revenue grew at its fastest pace in more than three years, bolstering investors’ expectations that China’s gaming and social media leader will weather a potential global downturn in 2025.
item.dc:creator: Zheping Huang

media:content.media:description: Signage at Tencent Holdings Ltd. offices in Shanghai.

item.title: What Huawei’s Comeback Says About US-China Tech War
item.description: When the Trump administration blacklisted Huawei Technologies Co. in 2019 over spying concerns, the move almost wiped out the Chinese company’s global smartphone business. Yet it bounced back with the support of China’s government, and is now at the center of national efforts to achieve technological independence from the West.
item.dc:creator: Yuan Gao, Edwin Chan

media:content.media:description: A Huawei Mate XT folding smartphone in Beijing.

item.title: Eight Sleep, Known For High-Tech Bedding, Expands to China Ahead of Eventual IPO
item.description: New $2,849 system uses AI to monitor heart rate and breathing patterns
item.dc:creator: Dana Wollman

media:content.media:description: Eight Sleep’s Pod 5 system.

item.title: Steelmaker Nucor Shuts Down Some Output After Cyberattack
item.description: Nucor Corp., the biggest steel manufacturer in North America, shut down production at some of its facilities after detecting an unauthorized intrusion into its computer systems.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gallagher

media:content.media:description: Bundles of steel from Nucor Corp. Photographer: Patrick Fallon/

item.title: Solo VC Effort Offers Individual Touch to Early Startup Founders
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ed Ludlow talks with Josh Browder, founder and chief executive officer of DoNotPay, about running a venture capital firm as the only partner.
item.dc:creator: Edward Ludlow

media:content.media:description: Josh Browder, founder and chief executive officer of DoNotPay, has raised a new fund for his venture firm, Browder Capital.

item.title: Josh Kushner’s Thrive Capital Gains $522 Million From Carvana Trade
item.description: The VC firm is making investments beyond private startups.
item.dc:creator: Kate Clark, Katie Roof

media:content.media:description: A Carvana vending machine in Uniondale, New York, US, on Tuesday, April 16, 2024. Carvana Co. is scheduled to release earnings figures on May 1.

item.title: US Data Center to Add Batteries Without Lithium Mined Overseas
item.description: The first battery will be installed in 2027 as part of a bid to provide reliable power.
item.dc:creator: Josh Saul

media:content.media:description: A render of the Wyoming data center.

item.title: Samsung to Buy FläktGroup for €1.5 Billion in AI Sector Play
item.description: Samsung Electronics Co. has agreed to buy FläktGroup Holding GmbH for €1.5 billion ($1.7 billion), acquiring the European heating and cooling specialist in its biggest overseas takeover in eight years.
item.dc:creator: Yoolim Lee

media:content.media:description: In this photo taken on April 30, 2024, Samsung manufactured air-conditioning units are seen outside a building in Seoul. (Photo by ANTHONY WALLACE / AFP) (Photo by ANTHONY WALLACE/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: DHL to Merge UK Delivery Unit With Evri in Latest Industry Deal
item.description: DHL eCommerce UK, part of Germany’s DHL Group, will merge with rival delivery service Evri, the latest in a string of deals in the crowded British courier space.
item.dc:creator: Katie Linsell

media:content.media:description: An Evri parcel and courier delivery company branded lorry on the M25 motorway in UK, on March 28, 2025.

item.title: Pony AI Is Said to Confidentially File for Hong Kong Listing
item.description: Autonomous-driving company Pony AI Inc. has confidentially filed for a Hong Kong listing to help raise capital to grow its business, according to people familiar with the situation.
item.dc:creator: Dong Cao, Linda Lew

media:content.media:description: A Pony.ai Inc. autonomous-driving vehicle.

item.title: Apple Partner Hon Hai Tempers Full-Year Sales Outlook
item.description: Hon Hai Precision Industry Co., the main manufacturer of iPhones and Nvidia Corp.-powered AI servers, cut its guidance for full-year revenue growth to reflect potential fallout from the US trade war.
item.dc:creator: Jane Lanhee Lee

media:content.media:description: Signage at the Foxconn Technology Group's campus in Longhua district in Shenzhen, China.

item.title: Panasonic CEO Says Battery Plans Align With Slower EV Demand
item.description: Panasonic Holdings Corp.’s decision not to rush into expanding capacity to build batteries has been validated by slower global demand for electric vehicles, Chief Executive Officer Yuki Kusumi said.
item.dc:creator: Reed Stevenson, Yuki Furukawa

media:content.media:description: Yuki Kusumi in Las Vegas, US.

item.title: Sony Sees $700 Million Tariff Hit on Underwhelming Outlook
item.description: Sony Group Corp. offered an underwhelming forecast for the year ahead, with the burden of US tariffs wiping out expectations for an increase in operating profit.
item.dc:creator: Yuki Furukawa, Takashi Mochizuki

media:content.media:description: The Sony PlayStation 5 Pro controller. Photographer: Kiyoshi Ota/Bloomberg

item.title: Ackman Quits Universal Music Board to Focus on Recent Investments
item.description: Billionaire Bill Ackman resigned from the board of Universal Music Group NV, the world’s largest music company, citing obligations arising from his recent investments.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Jacob

media:content.media:description: Bill Ackman Photographer: Jeenah Moon/Bloomberg

item.title: KDDI to Buy Back $2.7 Billion of Stock Including Kyocera’s Stake
item.description: KDDI Corp. said it will buy back as much as ¥400 billion ($2.7 billion) worth of its shares, with Toyota Motor Corp. and Kyocera Corp. tendering their stakes.
item.dc:creator: Mayumi Negishi

media:content.media:description: A KDDI Corp. logo.

item.title: Rakuten Reports Another Loss After Financing Costs Mount
item.description: Rakuten Group Inc. reported its 19th straight quarterly loss after financing costs mounted and it sought to turn around its struggling wireless operations.
item.dc:creator: Takahiko Hyuga

media:content.media:description: Visitors in the AI zone at the Rakuten Optimism event in Tokyo, in 2024.

item.title: Atos Announces Reorganization Aiming to Restart Sales Growth
item.description: Atos SE said it will simplify its organization and cut expenses as the embattled French IT group works to return to growth after years of setbacks.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Berthelot

media:content.media:description: The Atos SE headquarters in Paris. Photographer: Anita Pouchard Serra/Bloomberg

item.title: China’s Baidu Plans Robotaxi Expansion to Europe and Turkey
item.description: Baidu Inc. is planning to test and eventually launch autonomous ride-hailing service Apollo Go in Europe and Turkey, joining a growing number of Chinese self-driving technology companies in embarking on a global expansion.
item.dc:creator: Linda Lew, Zheping Huang

media:content.media:description: A Baidu Inc. Apollo RT6 robotaxi in Wuhan, China. Source: /Bloomberg

item.title: Tencent, Alibaba Results Key to Cementing China Tech Stock Rally
item.description: Earnings from the two biggest names in China tech are the next big watchpoint for clues on whether one of 2025’s hottest stock rallies is back on track.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang, Bailey Lipschultz

item.title: Carlyle Seeks $1.2 Billion Loan for India Hexaware M&A Refinance
item.description: Carlyle Group Inc is seeking about $1.2 billion in a syndicated loan to refinance debt used to acquire Mumbai-based software firm Hexaware Technologies Ltd., according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Chien Mi Wong, Kari Soo Lindberg

media:content.media:description: Hexaware’s CEO, Srikrishna Ramakarthikeyan, second from left, and other executives attend the company’s listing ceremony at the National Stock Exchange in Mumbai in February.

item.title: SoftBank Profit Doubles After ByteDance, Didi Values Surge
item.description: SoftBank Group Corp.’s profit soared 124% after valuations of tech startups like ByteDance Ltd. rose, in a boost for the Japanese company’s aggressive data center investment plans.
item.dc:creator: Min Jeong Lee

media:content.media:description: A SoftBank Corp. store in Yamato, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan, on Thursday, May 1, 2025. SoftBank Group is scheduled to release earnings figures on May 13. Photographer: Akio Kon/Bloomberg
